title: Sri Lanka stocks gain over 1-pct in mid-day trade
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka stocks gained over 1 percent within the first hour of trade on Wednesday(08) recouping some of the losses made in the last few session, Colombo Stock Exchange data showed.
The main All Share Price Index moved up 1.76 percent or 134.39 points to 7,765.52 at 11.35 hrs.
The most liquid index S&P SL20 up 3.18 percent or 78.04 points to 2,532.52.
However market generated a turnover of 711 million rupees, less than a quarter of this year’s average 3.8 billion rupees.
Top gainers were Expolanka, LOLC Holdings and John Keells Holdings.
